intro: Elaphoglossum nanchititlensis, commonly known as the Nanchitlán holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are typically adorned with small, spore-bearing sori on the underside of the leaves. This plant is native to Mexico, specifically found in the highlands of the state of Hidalgo. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in rocky or forested areas. The botanical features of Elaphoglossum nanchititlensis make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native habitat.
